DataElement.preferredName: Gastric Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Clinical stage group based on the combination of T, N, and M categories and relevant prognostic factors for gastric carcinoma, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the stomach._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the stomach.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System

ValueDomain.preferredName: Gastric Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Clinical Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the clinical staging of gastric cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 8th edition._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Stage IVB Gastric Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Stage IVB Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Clinical Stage IVB Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Stage IVA Gastric Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Stage IVA Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVA includes: (T4b, Any N, M0): T4b: Tumor invades adjacent structures/organs. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Clinical Stage IVA Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IVA includes: (T4b, Any N, M0): T4b: Tumor invades adjacent structures/organs. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Stage III Gastric Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Stage III Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage III includes: (T3, N1, N2, or N3, M0); (T4a, N1, N2, or N3, M0). T3: Tumor penetrates the subserosal connective tissue without invasion of the visceral peritoneum or adjacent structures. T4a: Tumor invades the serosa (visceral peritoneum). N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Clinical Stage III Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage III includes: (T3, N1, N2, or N3, M0); (T4a, N1, N2, or N3, M0). T3: Tumor penetrates the subserosal connective tissue without invasion of the visceral peritoneum or adjacent structures. T4a: Tumor invades the serosa (visceral peritoneum). N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Stage IIB Gastric Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Stage IIB Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIB includes: (T3, N0, M0); (T4a, N0, M0). T3: Tumor penetrates the subserosal connective tissue without invasion of the visceral peritoneum or adjacent structures. T4a: Tumor invades the serosa (visceral peritoneum). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Clinical Stage IIB Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIB includes: (T3, N0, M0); (T4a, N0, M0). T3: Tumor penetrates the subserosal connective tissue without invasion of the visceral peritoneum or adjacent structures. T4a: Tumor invades the serosa (visceral peritoneum). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Stage IIA Gastric Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Stage IIA Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIA includes: (T1, N1, N2, or N3, M0); (T2, N1, N2, or N3, M0). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Clinical Stage IIA Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIA includes: (T1, N1, N2, or N3, M0); (T2, N1, N2, or N3, M0). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N1: Tumor with metastasis in one or two regional lymph nodes. N2: Tumor with metastasis in three to six regional lymph nodes. N3: Tumor with metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Stage I Gastric Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Stage I Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I includes: (T1, N0, M0); (T2, N0, M0). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Clinical Stage I Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: (T1, N0, M0); (T2, N0, M0). T1: Tumor invades the lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Stage 0 Gastric Cancer AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Stage 0 Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0. Tis: Carcinoma in situ: intraepithelial tumor without invasion of the lamina propria, high grade dysplasia. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Clinical Stage 0 Gastric Cancer AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0. Tis: Carcinoma in situ: intraepithelial tumor without invasion of the lamina propria, high grade dysplasia. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)
